properties.name: A shout out ot Kari in Homer, AK
properties.description: Posted by LucylandKenai, AlaskaIn 2001 I was lucky enough to visit my dear friend Kari in Homer after walking the Mayor\'s Midnight Sun Marathon. HOmer was a complete delight and I still want to go back again.

properties.name: After spending 28 years in LA I finally went for my 40th bday
properties.description: Posted by LucylandTijuana, MexicoAnd then I saw Traffic....

properties.name: I heart Sarajevo
properties.description: Posted by LucylandSarajevoMy husband\'s home town and my next vacation destination. I\'m looking forward to visiting Culhan.

properties.name: I'll finally see the bridge
properties.description: Posted by LucylandMostarMy father was born in a tiny village outside of Mostar, closer to Medjugorje, and for my young life he always spoek of the bridge. The bridge was not there when I visted the first two times. I\'ll see it the third time but my father is no longer around for me to share my experience with. I\'m sure I\'ll cry standing there thinking about him.

properties.name: Kahalu'u Bay: My favorite crowded snorkeling spot

properties.name: Milna, aaaah....
properties.description: Posted by LucylandHvarI\'m not telling you where Milna is cos I want it all for myself....

properties.name: Minerva Terrace was magical
properties.description: Posted by LucylandYellowstone National ParkAs a pre-teen Yellowstone sparked the imagination in a fashion similar to the home of Pele on the Big Island.

properties.name: Only the North African tribal ladies had more tattoos than me
properties.description: Posted by LucylandParis, FranceI\'ll give Paris another chance, because there is a lot to appreciate, and hope the populace doesn\'t glare at me too much again. The next time will be easier since I\'m no longer a vegetarian.

properties.name: Reach for a book about the Sami and make a friend
properties.description: Posted by LucylandAmsterdam, NLAmsterdam is an amazing city I\'ve visited twice during the early 90s and am yearning to return once again. Is it the canals or the museums or the awesome Turkish food? The culture, the vibrancy? I suppose all of it...

properties.name: They have Rotis!
properties.description: Posted by LucylandToronto, OntarioMy mother was born in Toronto and the 3 times I\'ve visited her cousins I\'ve loved it.
